summary: Users cannot distinguish error types in TypeScript SDK logs because errors lose type information when passed between Worker and Workflow boundaries, preventing appropriate log level assignment and error categorization.
userImpact: Users cannot determine error origins or apply appropriate logging levels, making production debugging and error handling more difficult.
rootCause: NodeJS/V8 limitation: object prototypes and class information are lost when cloning objects across worker threads, as documented in NodeJS worker_threads API.
proposedFix: Introduce a type indicator field or code field in logged errors to distinguish error sources, potentially as a new non-breaking field alongside the existing failure field.
keyQuote: Currently users cannot distinguish error types in Temporal's TypeScript SDK logs, all logged errors appear as plain Error objects with no type information.
